context.description: TCPIPServerOutput node Use the TCPIPServerOutput node to create a server connection to a raw TCP/IP socket, and to send data over the connection to an external application.
Properties navigator This displays the node properties. Configure the node by selecting the properties and setting their values. Mandatory properties are marked with an asterisk.

topic.label: TCPIPServerOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerOutput node

context.description: Description page If you want to describe the purpose of the node in the message flow, use these fields to enter a short description, a long description, or both

topic.label: TCPIPServerOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerOutput node

context.description: Basic page Enter the host name, port number and timeout information for the TCPIPServerOutput node.

topic.label: TCPIPServerOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerOutput node

context.description: Request page Enter the location in the message tree of the data, host name and port number for the TCPIPServerOutput node.

topic.label: TCPIPServerOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerOutput node

context.description: Advanced page Enter advanced configuration information for the TCPIPServerOutput node: for example, whether the TCP/IP connection is closed after a record is sent.

topic.label: TCPIPServerOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerOutput node

context.description: Records and Elements page Specify how and to what extent you want your TCPIP records and elements to be processed.

topic.label: TCPIPServerOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerOutput node

context.description: Validation page Set these properties if you want the MRM parser to validate the body of messages using the dictionary generated from the message set, and choose the failure action to be taken.

topic.label: TCPIPServerOutput node - Configuring the TCPIPServerOutput node
